173.title: Global COVID toll may be 3 times the official toll, India saw 4mn deaths: Lancet
173.article_body: The number of people who died of COVID-19 worldwide could be more than three times the official toll of 5.9 million deaths (between January 2020 and December 2021), a study published in Lancet has said. It pegged the actual toll at 18.2 million and said that India saw 4.1 million COVID-19 deaths, accounting for 22% of the total global deaths.

174.title: China locks down city amid worst COVID outbreak in 2 yrs with 1,100 daily cases
174.article_body: China has locked down the northeastern city of Changchun, which has a population of around 90 lakh amid a new spike in COVID-19 cases attributed to the Omicron variant. China on Friday reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years. Out of the 1,100 new cases, 397 are local symptomatic cases.

175.title: Sharing stories of Warne has invigorated Australian team: Cummins
175.article_body: Australian Test captain Pat Cummins said his team is "still in disbelief" over the sudden death of legendary spinner Shane Warne on March 4. He added that after sharing various stories of Warne, "players are invigorated" to follow his blueprint in terms of playing to bring wins for team. "He's still one of our favourite ever cricketers," Cummins further said.

176.title: No player would want to sit out after that performance: Bumrah on Jadeja
176.article_body: Responding to a query about whether Ravindra Jadeja will be rested for India's second Test against Sri Lanka, Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't think any player would want to sit out after a performance like Jadeja's. Jadeja scored 175* in the first innings of the Mohali Test followed by a nine-wicket haul. He was named Player of the Match.

177.title: Drug peddler arrested with 7 kg ganja worth ₹8 lakh in Bengaluru
177.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police arrested a drug peddler on Friday. The crime branch has also seized seven kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹8 lakh, from the accused person's possession. It has also recovered ₹65,000 in cash and other items from the accused person, who is said to be from Odisha.

178.title: Steve Smith trolls himself over tweet on Australia's new debutant
178.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith took to Twitter to congratulate leg-spinner Mitchell Swepson, who'll be making his Test debut against Pakistan. "It's been a while since a leg-spinner debuted for Australia in Tests. I have no doubt Swepson will be far more successful than the last leggie," he wrote. Notably, Smith had made his debut for Australia as a leg-spinner.

179.title: Appreciate the Pakistan batters instead of saying they played slow: Babar
179.article_body: Reacting to criticism over Pakistan's run rate in the opening Test against Australia, Babar Azam said the Pakistan batters should be appreciated adding that they did not bat slowly. "Abdullah Shafique [played]...his fourth Test and Imam-ul-Haq was making his comeback," stated Babar. Pakistan scored 476 runs in the first innings with Imam, Azhar Ali scoring 157, 185 respectively.

180.title: I was just too greedy: 'Jalsa' director on casting Vidya, Shefali
180.article_body: Director Suresh Triveni has said that he was just too greedy when he thought of bringing actresses Vidya Balan and Shefali Shah together for 'Jalsa'. He has previously worked with Vidya in 2017 film 'Tumhari Sulu'. "Working with [Vidya]...you want to go back to her with another film...And of course, I've been following Shefali's work for some time," Suresh said.

181.title: Against our values: Germany's Deutsche Bank refuses to cut off ties with Russia
181.article_body: Amid various brands suspending their operations in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, Germany’s largest bank Deutsche Bank refused to cut ties with Russia. Bank’s Chief Executive Christian Sewing said, "We are often asked why we aren't withdrawing completely from Russia. The answer is that this would go against our values." Sewing added, "We've clients who cannot exit Russia overnight."

182.title: Russian soldiers' bodies seen scattered on snow; Ukrainian says 'leaving them for dogs'
182.article_body: Dead bodies of several Russian soldiers have been seen lying in the snow near Kharkiv in Ukraine. When asked about what will be done about the bodies, one of the Ukrainian soldiers said, "What do you think will happen, we will leave them for the dogs." A soldier said that Ukrainians are fighting to protect their families and land.

183.title: Sachin told batters to attack Warne while leading Mumbai: Ex-coach
183.article_body: Ex-Indian fast bowler Balwinder Singh Sandhu who was Sachin Tendulkar's coach while he was representing Mumbai, said Sachin asked all the Mumbai players to "attack" late cricketer Shane Warne, during a three-day game against Australia. "The plan to attack Warne worked well as it not only benefited the Mumbai team but also the Indian team," added Balwinder.

184.title: Pune's Bharosa Cell resolved 1,675 family disputes in 2021: Report
184.article_body: The Bharosa Cell of Pune Police has resolved 1,675 cases related to family disputes in 2021, according to Hindustan Times. A police official said that most of the disputes were among couples. "Their grievances are heard and senior officers of the team resolve them through counselling and patient hearing," the official added.

185.title: We weren't satisfied with screenplay: Akshay on OTT debut getting delayed
185.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, while talking about his OTT debut 'The End' being delayed again, said, "We were not satisfied with the screenplay. Amazon was not satisfied." The film, which was announced in 2019, was due to start at the end of this year. "If everything goes well, we should start by next year's beginning," Akshay added.

186.title: I'm not a method actor, I don't take it seriously: Akshay Kumar
186.article_body: Akshay Kumar, sharing his opinion on method acting, said, "I don't take it too seriously and it's called acting for a reason." "I'm not the one to lock myself in a room...I just want to act and go home. I'm not a method actor, I don't claim to be one," he added. Akshay will be next seen in 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

187.title: Want seniors to put their hands up: Powar on India's loss vs NZ in WC
187.article_body: Following India's loss against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, India's head coach Ramesh Powar said he wants seniors like Mithali Raj, Smriti Mandhana and Jhulan Goswami to put their hands up and help team win games single-handedly. "Because their participation...contributions in the win will brush off on...younger players," he added. It was India's first loss in the tournament.

188.title: Difficult for 2nd India-Sri Lanka Test to last beyond 3 days: Jaffer
188.article_body: Talking about Team India's second Test against Sri Lanka, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it is "difficult" for the match to last beyond three days, considering the performances of Sri Lanka. "There are many things that need to go in [Sri Lanka's] favour," added Jaffer. India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the opening Test.

189.title: Cong will never learn: Amarinder Singh on party's Punjab performance
189.article_body: Captain Amarinder Singh, who remained Punjab CM for over four years before being removed due to infighting in Congress, on Friday said Congress leadership will never learn after the party failed to retain power in Punjab. His response came after Congress blamed him for the results. "Who's responsible for the humiliating defeat...in UP? What about Manipur, Goa, Uttarakhand?" Singh asked.

190.title: My kids say 'Pops, this is old fashion' if I get trends wrong: Ajay
190.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has stated that he asks his kids, nephews and everybody younger than him what's cool because the language changes every three months. "I mean there are terms which are used and then you learn that term and use it and after three months, they turn around and say 'Pops, this is old fashion'," the actor added.

191.title: Bhagwant Mann meets Kejriwal, touches his feet after AAP's win in Punjab
191.article_body: A day after Aam Aadmi Party won the Punjab Assembly election, the party's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann met the party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi. A video shared by an AAP leader on Twitter showed Mann touching the feet of Kejriwal before hugging him. Mann was also seen touching the feet of AAP leader Manish Sisodia.

192.title: COVID-19 situation in Germany still critical: Health Minister
192.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach urged people not to assume that coronavirus pandemic is over. COVID-19 situation in Germany is still "critical", he said. "We've strongly rising case figures again...I keep reading that...Omicron...is a milder variant and that's only true to a limited extent," Lauterbach added. Germany has reported more than 2,50,000 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

193.title: Maruti among over 70 firms selected for auto components PLI scheme: Report
193.article_body: The government has selected over 70 companies for the auto components PLI scheme, Moneycontrol reported citing a report. Maruti Suzuki, Delphi TVS, Hella India, Dana Group, Minda Industries, Tata Auto Components, Bharat Forge are among the selected applicants. Firms from Germany, the US, the Netherlands, Japan, South Korea, France and Italy have also been selected.

194.title: Nazara Technologies to invest ₹30 cr in Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll
194.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed gaming and sports media platform Nazara Technologies has committed to invest ₹30 crore into Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll. Nazara will invest up to ₹10 crore upfront while the rest of ₹20 crore will be deployed over a period of 3 years. Griffin Gaming Partners had led a $65-million funding into social gaming platform Winzo.

195.title: 64 women rescued, 9 held after police raids illegal dance bar in B'luru
195.article_body: Nine people were detained for allegedly running an illegal dance bar at a restaurant and bar in Bengaluru. The Central Crime Branch officers conducted a raid and rescued 64 women from the bar on Wednesday. As per police, these women were initially hired as waitresses but later they were forced to wear obscene outfits and dance in front of customers.

196.title: Amyra Dastur donates bags, stationery, clothes to underprivileged kids
196.article_body: Amyra Dastur, known for films like 'Rajma Chawal' and 'Prassthanam', has donated school bags, stationery and clothes to the children of Shiksha Seva Foundation. She said "this is a small way" to help those kids who either dropped out of schools or stopped their education due to low finances amid COVID-19. "No one should be limited by...financial situation," Amyra added.

197.title: Nkrumah Bonner's century helps WI secure first innings lead against England
197.article_body: West Indies managed to get a 62-run lead with their first innings score being 373/9 at stumps on Day 3 of the Antigua Test on Thursday. Nkrumah Bonner's nine-hour-long knock of 123 runs was the standout performance of the day's play. English pacer Craig Overton and all-rounder Ben Stokes managed to pick two wickets each.

198.title: WV Raman put incredible pressure, players feared speaking to him: Ashwin
198.article_body: Sharing his experience while being trained under ex-India cricketer and former Tamil Nadu coach WV Raman, Ravichandran Ashwin said Raman inflicted "incredible" pressure on players, adding that players feared speaking to him. "If you didn't throw the ball at the top of the stumps, he would just have a go. He used to prod me," added Ashwin.

199.title: Every bowler with little pace fancies his chances against Rohit: Gavaskar
199.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said every bowler with a little pace "fancies" his chances while bowling to Rohit Sharma because of his pull shot, which creates an opportunity as he hits the ball in the air. "He should put it in cold storage till he gets to 80,90,100," added Gavaskar. "The percentages are not working in his favour," stated Gavaskar.

200.title: Don't blame him for trying to nullify the opposition: Cummins on Raja
200.article_body: Talking about Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja's statement that the Rawalpindi pitch was flat to "not play" into Australia's hands, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said he does not blame Raja for trying to "nullify" his team. "I found it a real positive that they went away from a wicket they would traditionally play there," added Cummins.

201.title: Telangana CM KCR hospitalised over pain in left arm, advised rest
201.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao was on Friday admitted to Yashoda Hospital in Somajiguda after he complained of pain in his left arm. His physician Dr MV Rao said he had been feeling weak for the past two days. No problem surfaced after an angiogram, hospital authorities said, adding that he was advised to rest for one week.

202.title: Prithviraj’s preponement brings huge smile to my face: Manushi Chhillar
202.article_body: Former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said she is extremely happy that her debut film 'Prithviraj' is releasing a week earlier. "The film was postponed twice due to the pandemic. So, its preponement definitely brings a huge smile to my face," Manushi said. Directed by Padma Shri Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the film also stars Akshay Kumar and Sanjay Dutt.

203.title: SpiceJet MD granted interim relief from arrest in alleged cheating case
203.article_body: SpiceJet promoter and Managing Director Ajay Singh has been granted interim protection from arrest by a Delhi court in connection with an alleged cheating case registered against him. The court said that no coercive action should be taken against Ajay Singh till March 28. It has further directed him to join the investigation regarding the transfer of SpiceJet shares.

204.title: It'll take us back 100 years: Russian tycoon on seizing assets of firms exiting Russia
204.article_body: Russia's richest person and President of Norilsk Nickel Vladimir Potanin warned that confiscating the assets of Western companies that left Russia after Ukraine's invasion will "take us back 100 years to 1917". "We shouldn't try to slam the door but endeavour to preserve Russia's economic position in those markets which we spent so long cultivating," the 61-year-old added.

205.title: Aditya Roy Kapur as a co-star is unmatchable: Sanjana Sanghi
205.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi while talking to ETimes said Aditya Roy Kapur is "unmatchable" as a co-star. "I know that even if he is trying to criticise my performance, it's coming from a good place," Sanjana said, adding, "[We] share...immense comfort in being able to express anything that's on our minds." They will be seen together in 'Om: The Battle Within'.

206.title: CM Bommai plans to build 4 new 'satellite towns' around Bengaluru
206.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday suggested that the Bengaluru city should be developed like a "planet surrounded by four satellites". He said, "Bengaluru should be...like a planet where there will be satellite towns along with the best of connectivity with rail, road, hi-tech travel systems." He added that at least four new Bengalurus have to be built around Bengaluru.

207.title: Google to send air raid alerts to Android users in Ukraine before expected attacks
207.article_body: Google will start sending air raid alerts to Android users in Ukraines before expected attacks happen near them. "Tragically, millions of people in Ukraine now rely on air strike alerts to try get to safety," Google noted, adding that it's working with Ukrainian government to roll out the feature starting today. The feature is adapted from Google's earthquake alert system.

208.title: Jaishankar praises Op Ganga, says evacuation from Sumy was challenging
208.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday praised the authorities for smooth implementation of Operation Ganga. He, however, said the evacuation of Indians from Sumy was particularly challenging. "Op Ganga, undertaken at the direction of PM Modi has delivered due to both leadership and commitment," he said. He also thanked Ukraine, its neighbours and Russia for their cooperation.

209.title: It would be a big mistake to close EU's door to Ukraine: Belgian PM
209.article_body: Belgian PM Alexander De Croo said it would be "big mistake" to close the European Union door to  Ukraine. However, he added that Ukraine must respect all the necessary procedural steps before it can become a member. He further said, "An EU membership process requires a lot of reforms...otherwise we'll have countries that will become members...without being ready for it."

210.title: DiDi halts Hong Kong listing on cybersecurity probe: Report
210.article_body: China's DiDi Global has suspended preparations for its planned Hong Kong listing after failing to appease Chinese regulators' demands that it overhaul its systems for handling sensitive user data, Bloomberg reported. China's CAC told the firm its proposals to prevent security and data leaks had fallen short. DiDi's main apps, removed from local app stores last year, will remain suspended.

211.title: Sisodia directs PWD to start repair works on Delhi roads by March 17
211.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has directed Public Works Department (PWD) to start repair works on city's roads by March 17. Sisodia has asked officials to repair all potholes by March 17 and complete patchwork by March 31. "All desilting...cleaning works should be done by May 31," a PWD order read. Sisodia was given additional charge of PWD in February.

212.title: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomes 2nd baby, calls him 'baby shark'
212.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomed her second baby with husband Varun Alagh on Thursday. Sharing a photo on Instagram, she wrote, "And then there were 2, our second son Ayaan is here to make our lives even more fun. Ayaan means 'blessing from god' and that’s what he is. Thanks for all the kind wishes and blessings. #babyshark"

213.title: Stereotypes are actor's drawback, producer's cash cow: Arshad Warsi
213.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi has called getting stereotyped a problem, adding that it is an actor's drawback and a producer's cash cow. "This guy does good action...Make him do it again and again," the actor said. Arshad added that most actors including himself are always on the lookout for something new but it has to happen organically and can't be engineered.

214.title: Akhilesh Yadav should seek forensic tests of EVM machines: Mamata
214.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee alleged that BJP won the Uttar Pradesh polls due to "loot and malpractices of EVM". She further told SP chief Akhilesh Yadav not to be "disheartened" and asked him to seek forensic tests of the same EVM machines. Lauding Akhilesh, she said, SP's vote percentage increased from 20% to 37% in this Assembly election.

215.title: NASA to open moon sample sealed 50 yrs ago to study them in new ways
215.article_body: NASA is about to open vacuum-sealed sample of moon collected during Apollo 17 mission in 1972. "Agency knew science and technology would evolve and allow scientists to study...material in new ways to address new questions," NASA's Lori Glaze said. This sample is expected to contain some gases. A different tool has been designed to capture these gases for further research.

216.title: Elephant dies due to electrocution in Assam's Kaziranga National Park
216.article_body: Forest officials informed that an elephant had died due to electrocution at Burapahar Tea Estate in Assam's Kaziranga National Park on Friday. P Sivakumar, Director, Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve, confirmed that the area where the accident took place falls under the Hatidandi animal corridor. The elephant died after it reportedly came in contact with an electric transformer.

217.title: Bhagwant Mann to take oath as Punjab CM on March 16
217.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Bhagwant Mann will take oath as the CM of Punjab on March 16. He has invited party President and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for the swearing-in ceremony. Mann will also hold a roadshow in Amritsar on March 13 along with Kejriwal. The Aam Aadmi Party won 92 seats in the Punjab Assembly elections.

218.title: People expect me to be sexy, sensual; I've typecast myself: Sunny
218.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has stated that she has typecast herself as people expect her to play a glamorous character and assume some sort of sexuality or sensuality is involved. "There are still lots of people who come to us saying, 'It is Sunny, we have to show this or that (something sexual)' and it doesn't bother me," the actress said.

219.title: EU aims to double military aid for Ukraine: Foreign policy chief
219.article_body: The European Union aims to double its military aid to Ukraine amid the invasion by Russia, EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Friday. The EU has proposed earmarking another 500 million euros for this purpose, Borrell added. The EU is also considering imposing more sanctions on Russian oligarchs and the Russian economy, he further said.

220.title: It was an absolute outlier: Pat Cummins on Rawalpindi Test
220.article_body: Talking about the drawn first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Australia Test skipper Pat Cummins said it was an absolute outlier. In all, 1,187 runs were scored for the loss of 14 wickets in the Test. Notably, the ICC even rated the pitch below average and handed it one demerit point. Second Test will begin on Saturday in Karachi.

221.title: Delhi Police arrests man & recovers 8 kilograms of ganja; probe on
221.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday arrested a man and recovered about eight kilograms of ganja from his possession. The accused person had allegedly come with a consignment of the contraband to deliver it to an unknown receiver in the Vikas Nagar area in Ranhola. Meanwhile, Delhi Police has launched an investigation to trace the source of ganja and its receivers.

222.title: 1 Army pilot killed, 1 injured in helicopter crash near LoC in Kashmir
222.article_body: One of the two pilots in the Indian Army Cheetah helicopter that crashed earlier today in North Kashmir's Gurez sector has died, Army officials said. The other pilot has been injured, officials said as per ANI. More details are awaited on the incident that reportedly took place due to poor weather.

223.title: Organised dad's evacuation from Kyiv, it was nerve-wracking: Director Stanislav
223.article_body: Ukrainian director Stanislav Kapralov spoke about how he and his friends evacuated his father from Kyiv amid the Russian invasion. Calling it an "incredibly nerve-wracking operation", Stanislav said, "He'd to be taken...to the point of evacuation. My friends agreed to pick him up." "He left with one backpack. Thank God, everything's fine and three days later, [he's]...in Warsaw," he added.

224.title: US startup Astrolab unveils rover that can be driven by astronauts on Moon
224.article_body: US startup Venturi Astrolab has unveiled a full-scale prototype of a new rover 'FLEX' designed to transport cargo and astronauts across Moon's surface. FLEX, which can be driven by astronauts, went through a five-day field test in a desert. If NASA adopts FLEX for Artemis, it would become the first passenger-capable rover to travel Moon's surface since Apollo 17 mission.

225.title: Odisha to conduct matriculation exam in offline mode from April 29
225.article_body: The Odisha government has decided to conduct the matriculation examination in offline mode from April 29. "It will be mandatory for all students...The exam would be held for one subject each day," state Chief Secretary SC Mahapatra said. The annual high school, Sanskrit board and State Open School examinations are slated to be held between April 29 and May 6.

226.title: CBSE releases date sheet for Class 10 and Class 12 Term 2 board exams
226.article_body: CBSE on Friday released the date sheet for both Class 10 and Class 12 Term 2 board examinations. The examinations are scheduled from April 26, 2022. The time of the start of the examination will be 10:30 am. Other competitive examinations including JEE Main have been taken care of while preparing the date sheet, said CBSE.

227.title: How has the COVID-19 pandemic changed after 2 years according to experts?
227.article_body: With countries shifting toward a return to normal after two years of COVID-19, US-based expert Neil J Sehgal said, "Every country will have to learn to live with COVID-19." Officials encourage use of masks, ventilating spaces, instead of advising to wipe down surfaces like they did earlier. WHO has cleared 10 vaccines, with several anti-viral drugs and pills in circulation.

228.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami resigns, to continue as acting Uttarakhand CM
228.article_body: Uttarakhand CM and BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami, along with his state cabinet, resigned on Friday, a day after results for polls were announced. "He [Governor] told me to continue until the new government is sworn in...We've received the love of people and saw unprecedented results," Dhami said. Though BJP retained power in Uttarakhand, Dhami lost from the Khatima seat.

229.title: Former NSE official Anand Subramanian denies being 'yogi' who influenced Chitra
229.article_body: After the CBI informed a Delhi court that he impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' to influence former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's decisions, Anand Subramanian through his lawyer said, "I'm not the 'yogi'". Subramanian's lawyer argued that the co-location scam took place between 2010 and 2014 while the accused had joined in 2013. The CBI argued that Subramanian was a flight risk.

230.title: Anushka Sharma shares video from her cricket training for 'Chakda 'Xpress'
230.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to give a glimpse of how she's preparing for her next film, 'Chakda 'Xpress', where she'll play the role of Indian cricketer Jhulan Goswami. She shared a video wherein she's seen practising on a field and doing some workout routines. "Get-Sweat-Go! Chakda 'Xpress prep getting hard and intense as we are counting days," Anushka wrote.

231.title: 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since war began: UN
231.article_body: The International Organization for Migration said 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading the country on February 24. "The number of people in need of urgent humanitarian assistance is increasing by the hour," it added. Separately, the UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi said "about two million people are displaced inside Ukraine" due to "senseless war".

232.title: Justice Vipin Sanghi appointed acting Chief Justice of Delhi HC
232.article_body: Justice Vipin Sanghi has been appointed as the acting Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court. Justice Sanghi will take charge from "March 13 consequent upon the retirement of Justice Dhirubhai Naranbhai Patel, CJ, Delhi High Court", the official notification read. The 60-year-old was appointed as an Additional Judge of the Delhi High Court in 2006.

233.title: Police officer found dead at friend's rented room in J&K's Rajouri
233.article_body: A 36-year-old police officer, who hails from Poonch, was found dead at a friend's rented room in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri on Thursday. The friend, who is also a police officer, was not present in the rented room when the incident occurred, an official said. The official added that prima facie, the case appears to be of suicide.

234.title: I accept people's mandate: KP Maurya on poll defeat in UP's Sirathu
234.article_body: After facing defeat in the UP Assembly elections, UP's Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is worker of BJP, and will do whatever the party tells him to do. Maurya lost from the Sirathu Assembly seat by 7,337 votes to SP's Pallavi Patel. "With all humility, I accept the mandate of the people of Sirathu constituency," he added.

235.title: Russian forces killed more Ukrainian civilians than soldiers: Ukraine
235.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said that Russian forces invading Ukraine have killed more Ukrainian civilians than soldiers. "I want this to be heard not only in Kyiv but all over the world," Reznikov added. Separately, Russia's main attack force in northern Ukraine has been stalled on a highway north of Kyiv since the initial days of...invasion, according to Reuters.

236.title: Central agencies should join CCTNS for effective policing: Amit Shah
236.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said all the central agencies should join the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network & Systems (CCTNS) for effective policing through e-governance. While addressing the 37th Foundation Day celebrations of the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB), Shah further suggested the states to use NCRB data to form their yearly police force strategy.

237.title: Have to make mental adjustments while preparing for pink-ball Tests: Bumrah
237.article_body: India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said his side is making "mental adjustments" ahead of Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru, as pink-ball Tests are a "fairly new concept". He added, "Playing under light, fielding and bowling with pink ball are things we need to get used to." It'll be India's third pink-ball Test at home.

238.title: US addresses used China systems for cyberattacks on Russia: Report
238.article_body: Chinese state media Xinhua claimed China has experienced continuous cyberattacks in which US internet addresses have been used to seize control of Chinese computers to target Belarus, Russia and Ukraine. It cited China's cybersecurity technical centre, CNCERT/CC, in its report. "These overseas groups attacked by taking control of computers in the country," the report quoted the centre as saying.

239.title: HC upholds Maha govt's decision denying job to woman over two-child norm
239.article_body: Bombay HC upheld Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation's (MIDC) decision denying employment to a woman in place of her father, who died in 2013, citing the state's two-child norm. MIDC earlier turned down her application for the appointment in 2019. The woman has four siblings and their family was ineligible for a job in place of her father, MIDC had said.

240.title: When 1st floor can be reopened, why not others: HC to Centre on Nizamuddin Markaz
240.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Centre to clear its stand on why is it not allowing the other floors of Nizamuddin Markaz to reopen. This comes after the Centre told the court that it has no objection to allowing people to offer prayers on the first floor on Shab-e-Barat and during the month of Ramadan.

241.title: Army helicopter crashes near LoC in Kashmir, rescue operations on
241.article_body: An Indian Army Cheetah helicopter crashed near the LoC in the Gurez sector in north Kashmir on Friday afternoon, officials said. The helicopter crashed while it was on its way to pick up sick BSF personnel, PTI reported while quoting officials. It was about to land when it "drifted away" due to poor weather and rescue operations are ongoing.

242.title: 2 men on bike snatch woman's gold chain in Gurugram, case filed
242.article_body: Two bike-borne men allegedly snatched the gold chain of a school teacher in Gurugram Sector 40 on Wednesday, while she was returning home. The victim was riding her Activa scooter when the accused rammed her vehicle. "As I stopped the scooter, the accused seated pillion snatched my gold chain," she said. An FIR has been registered.

243.title: Russia bombs psychiatric hospital with 330 people inside in Ukraine
243.article_body: Russian forces have bombed a psychiatric hospital with 330 people inside in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, the regional authorities have claimed. Oleh Synegybov, governor of the region, said that 73 people had been evacuated from the hospital. He further said that some people inside the hospital had been confined to wheelchairs and were unable to move.

244.title: 1st gay couple marries in Chile as same-sex marriage law takes effect
244.article_body: Chile's Javier Silva and Jaime Nazar on Thursday became the first same-sex couple to marry in the South American country after a law allowing same-sex marriage went into effect. "Being the first to get married in Chile is an honour...It's something we didn't think could happen," Silva said. They have been together for seven years and have two adopted children.

245.title: Russia stages military beauty contest for female troops amid Ukraine war
245.article_body: Russia staged a military beauty contest called 'Makeup under Camouflage' for its female troops amid the Ukraine invasion. The first test was the application of combat makeup, according to military magazine Red Star. They were also expected to overcome a fire-assault zone in a mock war zone with radiation, chemical and biological threats wearing gas masks and special protection suits.

246.title: Subramanian thought he can be 'yogi' & no one would identify: CBI to court
246.article_body: The CBI on Friday told a Delhi court that the NSE's former Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' and influenced the decisions of former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Speaking in the co-location case, the CBI said Subramanian "thought he can be yogi for four years and no one would identify. He was operating the email IDs."

247.title: Cricket Ireland to invest €1.5 million in women's cricket
247.article_body: Cricket Ireland has announced that it will invest €1.5 million to further improve women's cricket in the country. The investment amount is three times more than what the board allocated in 2019. The board will distribute seven full-time contracts this time which means that Ireland will get their first-ever full-professional women's cricketers going into the 2022 summer season.

248.title: Mumbai man convicted in 6 days for kidnapping 6-yr-old, gets 2-yr-jail
248.article_body: A 29-year-old resident of Malad in Mumbai, who had kidnapped a six-year-old girl from Palghar district on March 4, was sentenced to two years of rigorous imprisonment by a magistrate court on Wednesday. The accused was arrested on March 6. He had lured the girl using chocolate and then left her fearing that police may trace him.

249.title: Haryana man arrested in Assam for snatching ATM cards from people
249.article_body: East Guwahati Police Department (EGPD) arrested a man belonging to Haryana's Hisar after they seized 17 ATM cards of different banks from his possession in Guwahati. EGPD took to Twitter to inform that the accused, identified as Ramdiya used to snatch ATM cards from people. Further investigation is underway, police added in the tweet.

250.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 36°C over next 6 days
250.article_body: India Meteorological Department has predicted that Delhi's maximum temperature is likely to rise to about 36°C over the next six days. The maximum temperature in the city is likely to rise up to 34°C by March 15 and further to 36°C by March 17. Notably, Delhi's air quality has remained in the "moderate" or "poor" categories from March 1 onwards.

251.title: Husband Goldie Behl told me to come back to work post cancer: Sonali
251.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has revealed that her husband filmmaker Goldie Behl has been encouraging her to get back to work "for the longest time". The actress was diagnosed with metastatic cancer in 2018 and took a break from work. Sonali has now returned to work as a judge on the reality television show 'Dance India Dance Lil Masters Season 5'.

252.title: Allegations on principal institutions do not seem gracious: Lekhi to Kejriwal
252.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal alleged that the Centre forced Election Commission to delay MCD polls, BJP's Meenakashi Lekhi said that such allegations on principal institutions "do not seem gracious". "I'd like to ask Kejriwal Ji, can any city survive without Municipal Corporation? As he has now started the process of removing Municipalities," Lekhi added.

253.title: Sometimes sharks sleep with their eyes open, find scientists
253.article_body: Australian scientists have found that sometimes sharks sleep with their eyes wide open. In order to study their sleeping patterns, scientists collected seven draughtsboard sharks from Hauraki Gulf in New Zealand. They found during sleep some sharks remained inactive for more than five minutes with their eyes closed, but 38% of the time their eyes were found to be open.

254.title: Man caught having illicit affair with daughter-in-law kills son in Rajasthan
254.article_body: A 64-year-old man, who was allegedly having an affair with his daughter-in-law, strangulated his son to death in Rajasthan. Police said the deceased's wife was also an accomplice in the crime. The deceased had allegedly caught his father and wife in a compromising position, police added. The accused hanged his body from a fan to make it look like suicide.

255.title: McDonald's burger being sold for ₹26,000 online in Russia after closure; pics surface
255.article_body: After McDonald's announced that it is temporarily shutting down all its restaurants in Russia amid war with Ukraine, several online listings showed people selling McDonald's burgers and meals for high prices in Russia. Some pictures showed burgers being sold for 40,000 rubles (around ₹26,000), while a two bags of McDonald's food was on sale for 100,000 rubles around ₹66,000.

256.title: Got more than 5,000 wedding proposals after 'Baahubali': Prabhas
256.article_body: Actor Prabhas in an interview has revealed that more than 5,000 wedding proposals came for him after his film 'Baahubali'. The actor further said that his mother wants him to get married and he had told her that he will think about it after the film. "I will definitely get married...I will have a love marriage," Prabhas added.

257.title: Richa dresses as Smita Patil for cover of magazine, son Prateik reacts
257.article_body: Richa Chadha took to Instagram to pay tribute to late actress Smita Patil. Richa dressed up like Smita and posed for the cover of a magazine's Women's Day special edition. Sharing the picture, she wrote, "Homage to the inimitable Smita Patil." The late actress' actor-son Prateik Babbar reacted to her post and dropped a heart emoji in the comments section.

258.title: You reap what you sow: Navjot Singh Sidhu on Punjab poll results
258.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday reacted to the party's defeat in Punjab Assembly elections, saying, "You reap what you sow." "I'm not going into a deep thought of whether people accepted [Charanjit Channi's] face as CM's candidate or not," he added. Sidhu was also defeated by AAP candidate Jeevan Jyot Kaur from the Amritsar East constituency seat.

259.title: Hyderabad Police busts loan app fraud run by Chinese national; 2 arrested
259.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested two persons, both residents of Karnataka, for allegedly cheating people via a loan app run by a Chinese national. Police said the accused offered loans for a short period, following which victims had to pay huge interest. When the victims failed to repay the money, the accused posted their morphed photos on social media, police added.

260.title: 3 heart patients die at Delhi hospital, families blame faulty stents
260.article_body: Three patients with heart blockage have died at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital on Monday. The patients' families alleged the hospital used faulty stents. However, the doctors rejected the allegations, saying two of the three patients were critical and died before the stents could be implanted. Meanwhile, the Delhi government has set up a committee to review the matter.

261.title: Volunteers welcome to help fight against Ukrainian forces: Putin
261.article_body: Speaking at a Russian security council meeting, Russia's President Vladimir Putin said that he wanted to allow volunteers to fight against Ukrainian forces. The Russian Defence Minister said that there were 16,000 volunteers in Middle East who were ready to come to fight in Ukraine. Putin has also approved handing over captured Western missile systems to Russian-backed Ukrainian rebel fighters.

262.title: India's pace bowling is becoming fearsome: Karim ahead of pink-ball Test
262.article_body: Ahead of India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test in Bengaluru, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim said the hosts' pace bowling is becoming fearsome, adding Sri Lanka's batting is weak. "We have bowlers who can generate pace and movement. It will be very difficult for Sri Lanka to compete with them given the circumstances," he added. The Day-Night Test will begin on Saturday.

263.title: Let MCD elections take place: Delhi CM Kejriwal to PM Modi
263.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has urged PM Narendra Modi to let Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections take place and added that deferring the polls would be "a big threat to democracy". "Date for polls was to be announced...on March 9 but the same day...Centre wrote to State EC to combine all three civic bodies into one," Kejriwal added.

264.title: Video of Mann asking 'what is govt?' on a comedy show judged by Sidhu goes viral
264.article_body: An old video of AAP's Bhagwant Mann participating in a comedy show, where Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu was a judge, has gone viral, after Punjab Assembly election results. The video shows Mann explaining what "gormint" (government) means. "The one that looks closely (gaur se) at every issue but forgets about it in a minute is called gormint," he said.

265.title: Child learns to walk only after falling: Ex-Miss Bikini India Archana on losing UP polls
265.article_body: After losing UP polls by getting just 1,519 votes, ex-Miss Bikini India and Congress candidate Archana Gautam said, "I received a lot of love from the people of Hastinapur...I just didn't get their trust." She added, "Very soon, I will also win their trust." She added, "Child learns to walk only after falling...nobody is born having learned from the womb."

266.title: SBI app users spammed with random notifications, bank says fixing issue
266.article_body: Several users of SBI's Yono Lite app took to Twitter on Friday to complain that they were spammed with multiple notifications for instant personal loans. "Since morning I got hundreds of random notifications from Yono app...with different names," one Twitter user wrote. SBI tweeted, "Our technical team is working to resolve this issue. Please bear with us."

267.title: Show respect: Tuchel to Chelsea fans chanting owner Abramovich's name
267.article_body: Reacting to Chelsea fans chanting Russian owner Roman Abramovich's name during the scheduled minute of applause for Ukraine before a Premier League match, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said the fans should show "respect". Abramovich's assets have been frozen due to sanctions by the UK, after "clear evidence" over his connection to Vladimir Putin as per UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

268.title: Godrej Properties launches 3 signature towers in Chandivali-Powai
268.article_body: Godrej Properties is launching three signature towers as part of Godrej Urban Park, which it said is strategically located 5 minutes from Powai and 16 minutes from WEH, EEH. Homes here offer elevated lifestyle with 30+ amenities across three lifestyle annexes, said Godrej Properties, adding that customers booking now can avail launch offer: pay 10% now and rest at OC*.

269.title: Kuldeep hasn't been dropped, he has been released due to bubble fatigue: Bumrah
269.article_body: Team India vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah has clarified that Kuldeep Yadav has not been dropped from Test squad for the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka but has been released due to bubble fatigue. Bumrah said, "He has been in bubble for a long time. Staying in a bubble is not easy. The mental aspect is important," Bumrah added.

270.title: Ukraine has lost all communications with Chernobyl: UN nuclear watchdog
270.article_body: Ukraine has lost all communications with the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Thursday. This came a day after the Russian-controlled site lost external power supplies. IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said the agency is aware of reports that power has been restored to the site and is looking for confirmation.

271.title: BJP shouldn't suffer from indigestion from poll victory: Shiv Sena
271.article_body: Shiv Sena on Friday said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' that "BJP shouldn't suffer from indigestion" from its election victory as it's "more difficult to digest victory than defeat". BJP is set to form governments in four states that went to polls. The poll results' impact on Maharashtra will be like "monkeys getting hold of a bottle of liquor", it added.

272.title: $117 billion wiped off Tesla rival Rivian's market cap in 4 months
272.article_body: US-based electric vehicle startup Rivian has lost about $117 billion in market value in just four months. Rivian's market valuation had topped $153 billion a few weeks after its initial public offer (IPO), but the company's valuation now stands at about $36 billion. Rivian briefly became the second most valuable automaker in the US after billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla.

273.title: Haryana govt planning to hold Surajkund Mela twice a year
273.article_body: Haryana government is planning to hold the Surajkund Mela twice a year, Faridabad's district administration officials said. The authorities are planning to hold the fair, which aims to promote craftsmanship, before the onset of the winter season in November as well. The 35th edition of the fair will be held from March 19-April 4 after a gap of two years.

274.title: 'Musk & I have broken up again,' says Grimes after secretly welcoming 2nd child together
274.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes, who revealed to Vanity Fair that she and Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed their second child via surrogacy in December, shared that they've broken up. "Me and E have broken up *again* since the writing of this article...but he's my best friend and the love of my life," she tweeted. They have named their daughter Exa Dark Sideræl.

275.title: Rihanna planning IPO for her lingerie company at $3 billion valuation: Report
275.article_body: Singer Rihanna is reportedly working with advisers on taking her lingerie company Savage X Fenty public, which could value her lingerie company at $3 billion or more. The report claims that the listing could happen this year but the company hasn’t made any official decision yet. Savage X Fenty was launched in 2018 as an online-only brand.

276.title: Indians to explain what caused this: Pak as it claims Indian missile landed on its soil
276.article_body: After claiming that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed at a place 124 km within Pakistani territory, Pakistani Major General Babar Iftikhar said, "Whatever caused this incident to happen, it's for the Indians to explain." He added that Pakistan "strongly protests" this and "cautions against recurrence of any such incident in future". India is yet to respond to Pakistan's allegations.

277.title: EU will not sanction Russian gas or oil: Hungary PM Orban
277.article_body: The European Union will not impose sanctions on Russian gas or oil, Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said in a Facebook post on Friday. "So, Hungary's energy supply is secure in the upcoming period," Orban added. Most of Hungary's oil and natural gas imports come from Russia. His comments came as EU leaders gathered in France to discuss the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

278.title: Maha sanctions ₹131 cr to modernise Pune's Yerawada mental hospital
278.article_body: Maharashtra government has sanctioned ₹131 crore for the modernisation and upgradation of Pune's Yerawada regional mental hospital, believed to be one of the largest mental hospitals in Asia. "The old buildings in the campus belong to the British era and have grown old and dilapidated," the facility's superintendent said. An order granting permission for the project was issued on Wednesday.

279.title: Aadhaar card helps reunite disabled K'tata man with mother after 6 yrs
279.article_body: 19-year-old Bharat with hearing impairment, who was found at Nagpur Railway Station in 2016, reunited with his mother in Karnataka on Wednesday. Back then he was sent to an orphanage. When the orphanage's counsellor applied for Bharat's Aadhaar card, his biological details were found to be linked with another Aadhaar card registered in 2012, using which they reached his mother.

280.title: Police seize 240 gm of heroin in Assam, one arrested
280.article_body: A 26-year-old drug peddler was arrested by police in Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Thursday after they seized 240 grams of heroin from his possession. Police said they had carried out an operation in front of Hotel Dream Sky under Khatkhati Police station near the Bokajan area. They recovered the drug from 19 soapboxes from the accused.

281.title: Kerala earmarks ₹10 crore for studies of students evacuated from Ukraine
281.article_body: Presenting the Kerala Budget for 2022-23 on Friday, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said ₹10 crore has been earmarked to help the students, who returned to the state in wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, to continue their studies. Balagopal added that 3,123 people have returned safely to the state through various flights, including 15 chartered flights, amid the crisis.

282.title: Deeply concerned over laws targeting LGBTQ+ in US : Apple CEO
282.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook has expressed his concerns over US laws targeting the LGBTQ+ community amid controversy on a US bill that prohibits classroom discussion of sexual orientation and gender identity for many young students. "As a proud member of...LGBTQ+ community, I am deeply concerned about laws being enacted across the country," Cook said. Florida lawmakers passed the bill earlier.

283.title: UP is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come: Fadnavis
283.article_body: A day after the BJP won a majority in three states in the Assembly polls, ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said that "now the fight will be in Mumbai", referring to the upcoming municipal polls. "We won't be against any party, we'll be against bribery & corruption...Uttar Pradesh is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come," the BJP leader added.

284.title: Naxal commander carrying ₹3 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
284.article_body: A Naxal commander, carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head, was killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Friday, an official said. According to police, the encounter took place near Mosla where an armed group opened fire on the patrolling team. A jawan of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) was injured in the operation, police added.

285.title: Samajwadi Party leader attempts self-immolation after party's defeat in UP polls
285.article_body: The Vice President of Samajwadi Party's (SP) Kanpur unit, Narendra Singh alias Pintu, allegedly attempted suicide by setting himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Lucknow on Thursday, police said. The incident took place after SP lost the Uttar Pradesh election to the BJP. Singh has suffered 30% burn injuries and is stated to be in a critical condition.

286.title: Canada restaurant changes signature dish's name from 'The Vladimir' to 'The Volodymyr'
286.article_body: A Canadian restaurant chain that makes a local delicacy of fries topped with gravy and cheese curds has changed the name of its signature dish following customer complaints after Russia's war with Ukraine. Frite Alors! used to call the dish "The Vladimir" after the Russian President. The dish is now called "The Volodymyr" in honour of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

287.title: UNSC to discuss US, Ukraine biowarfare labs at Russia's request
287.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will meet on Friday to discuss Russia's claims about alleged US "military biological activities" in Ukraine. Russia's request for the UNSC meet came after the US rejected Moscow's accusations that the US was operating biological warfare labs in Ukraine and suggested Russia may be laying the groundwork to use a chemical or biological weapon.

288.title: Delhi University teachers to hold protests over multiple issues
288.article_body: The Delhi University Teachers' Association (DUTA) will conduct a series of protests over multiple issues including the merger of the College of Art with Ambedkar University and the absorption of ad-hoc teachers. According to DUTA President AK Bhagi, the association will conduct a dharna on March 22 followed by college-wise demonstrations in multiple phases on March 25, 28 and 29.

289.title: Russian missile strikes house in Ukraine killing 11 of 12 family members, pics surface
289.article_body: A Russian missile hit a house in Ukraine's Marhalivka, killing 11 of the 12 family members. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared pictures of the man and his cat who survived the strike. The ministry revealed that the man and his family had left Kyiv to be safe. The man lost his wife, daughter, mother-in-law, sister, sons-in-law, grandchildren and nieces.

290.title: Couldn't process what was happening: Deepika recalls her 1st meeting with SRK
290.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who made her Bollywood debut in 2007 with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Om Shanti Om', revealed that she was "almost in a daze" when she first met the actor. Calling him "India's biggest superstar", she said, "I remember just sitting at the edge of...sofa, being so nervous, and almost in a daze. I couldn't even process what was happening."

291.title: B'luru metro train flagged off with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav images
291.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) Managing Director Anjum Parwez has flagged off a metro train wrapped with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav graphics in Bengaluru. A video of the event shows people waving green flags as the train begins its trip. Earlier, a study showed that metro trains have significantly contributed to the reduction of carbon emission in the city.

292.title: Destroy high-threat pathogens in labs as they may be bombed: WHO to Ukraine
292.article_body: The WHO has asked Ukraine to destroy high-threat pathogens in labs to prevent "any potential spills" as the facilities may be bombed amid Russia's attack. Biosecurity experts have said that Russia's movement of troops into Ukraine and bombardment of its cities have raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens.

293.title: Delhi Police personnel who violate traffic rules could be fined double
293.article_body: Delhi Additional CP Traffic Ajay Krishan Sharma issued an order warning the police personnel that a double penalty will be imposed against them if found violating traffic rules. This comes after there were numerous complaints on social media against traffic rule violations by Delhi Police personnel. He has also instructed traffic police to prosecute police officers who violate traffic rules.

294.title: Lava flows as Indonesia's Mount Merapi continues to erupt
294.article_body: Indonesia's most active volcano Mount Merapi on Java island continued to erupt on Friday, forcing local authorities to halt tourism and mining activities on the slopes of the volcano. The volcano began unleashing clouds of hot ash and lava before midnight on Wednesday. Mount Merapi's last major eruption was in 2010, in which more than 345 people were killed.

295.title: Masaba says she gets roles of 'girl with acne or with troubled childhood'
295.article_body: Masaba Gupta, when asked about the kind of roles she was offered earlier in her career, said, "No roles were coming my way." "Even today, whatever is coming is very like 'somebody who'd troubled childhood, or acne'," she said, adding, "I don't think I ever get a role that's...focus of a man's life [or] where I can be romanced."

296.title: Every player except Jadeja will still be kicking themselves: Russel
296.article_body: Discussing Team India's first Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said every Indian player barring Ravindra Jadeja will still be "kicking themselves". "Even Rishabh Pant [who scored 96 runs in the first innings of the opening Test]," added Russel. "Pathum Nissanka is struggling, that's a big blow [for Sri Lanka]," stated Russel.

297.title: PM Modi assures support to AAP in Punjab, Kejriwal says 'Thank you, sir'
297.article_body: Hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Twitter for its victory in Punjab Assembly elections, AAP chief and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "Thank you, sir." "I assure all possible support from the Centre for Punjab's welfare," the Prime Minister had written on Twitter on Thursday.

298.title: PM holds roadshow in Gujarat after BJP returns to power in 4 states
298.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday held a roadshow in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after BJP won Assembly elections in UP, Uttarakhand and Manipur, and became the single largest party in Goa. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and state BJP president CR Paatil were accompanying PM Modi. PM will address Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan which will be attended by over one lakh Panchayati Raj representatives.

299.title: I will be editing photos during quarantine: PBKS coach Anil Kumble
299.article_body: Discussing his plans for the three days of "hard quarantine" before Punjab Kings' (PBKS) training for IPL 2022 begins, PBKS coach Anil Kumble who is passionate about photography said he will be "editing" his photos. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26 with defending champions CSK taking on IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the first match.

300.title: Govt invites applications from drone industry for ₹120 cr PLI scheme
300.article_body: The government has invited applications for the production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for drones and drone components. Last year, the Cabinet had cleared a PLI scheme worth ₹120 crore for drone industry. Under the scheme, the incentive for a manufacturer of drones and drone components will be 20% of the "value addition" made by the company during the next three years.

301.title: Maha Traffic Police collects e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 cr in a month
301.article_body: The Maharashtra Highway Police collected e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 crore from 11.60 lakh motorists in a month's time. This comes after the police issued pre-litigation notices to the defaulters asking them to be present before the court on March 12 for non-payment of e-challans. The Highway Traffic Police had started this exercise of serving pre-litigation notices to motorists in 2021.

302.title: Pune policeman arrested for forging service record to apply for President's medal
302.article_body: A havaldar attached to Pune City Police's special branch has been arrested for allegedly forging his service record while submitting the application for the President's Police Medal for meritorious service. Along with the policeman, three others, including two clerks and the policeman's aide, who was the daybook in-charge at Wanwadi police station in 2019, were booked for cheating and forgery.

303.title: Punjab CM Channi submits resignation to Governor after defeat in polls
303.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi on Friday submitted his resignation to Governor Banwarilal Purohit after Congress' defeat in the Assembly elections. Congress won 18 seats in the polls, with Channi losing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Congress' Punjab chief Navjot Singh also lost from the Amritsar East seat.

304.title: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress' Archana gets 1,519 votes in UP polls
304.article_body: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress candidate from Uttar Pradesh's Hastinapur, Archana Gautam, got only 1,519 votes in the Assembly elections. BJP candidate Dinesh won from Hastinapur with 1,07,587 votes, while SP candidate Yogesh Verma received 1,00,275 votes. Gautam thanked the people who voted for her.

305.title: Russian forces attack Kharkiv institute housing nuclear reactor: Ukraine
305.article_body: Ukraine has accused Russia of "nuclear terrorism" after Russian forces shelled an institute in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv, which houses a nuclear reactor. The shelling caused a fire in a neighbouring hostel, which has now been put out. Russian forces have already taken over two nuclear power plants in Ukraine, raising concerns about the security of the nuclear facilities.

306.title: Ian Healy criticised for 'Not surprised' comment on Shane Warne's demise
306.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has been criticised for his remark on Shane Warne's demise wherein he said that Shane's "early passing" didn't surprise him as he "didn't look after his body". "Healy, pull your head in. The time to make a claim that you were 'right' here is ill-timed," a fan said. "How disgraceful of Healy!" wrote another.

307.title: Online registration for Amarnath yatra to begin from April
307.article_body: Shri Amarnath Shrine Board (SASB) will begin online registrations for Amarnath yatra from April, the board confirmed on Thursday. "The online registration will start through banks in the month of April 2022 with a limit of 20,000 registrations fixed per day," SASB official said. The pilgrims can also make on-spot registration at designated counters during yatra days, he added.

308.title: SC to hear plea against Ashish Mishra's bail on March 15 in Lakhimpur case
308.article_body: Supreme Court said that it will hear a plea challenging the bail granted to Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Mishra Teni's son, Ashish Mishra on March 15. He is the prime accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. Ashish was arrested in October 2021 after at least four farmers and a journalist were killed in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri.

309.title: No global firm can touch Russia's blood money, thank you Mastercard: Ukraine Vice PM
309.article_body: Days after Mastercard suspended its operations in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said, "I'm sure...no global company can touch Russia's blood money as long as its tanks and missiles kill Ukrainians." "Thank you, Mastercard, for the first steps towards peace, but have you terminated all financial contracts with Russia?" he wrote on Twitter.

310.title: India becomes world's 5th most-valued stock market, beats UK: Report
310.article_body: India has become the fifth most-valued stock market, beating the UK, Canada and Saudi Arabia, Moneycontrol reported. The Indian market has lost around $257.35 billion since the start of 2022 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine and its value is currently above $3 trillion. The US stock market, which is world's most-valued at $47.32 trillion, has lost $6.6 trillion this year.

311.title: Saheb's clever attempt: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on PM's 2024 remark
311.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi said that 2022 UP election results have decided 2024 Lok Sabha results, political strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "Battle for India will be fought and decided in 2024 & not in any state elections." "Saheb knows this! Hence this clever attempt to create frenzy around state results to establish a decisive psychological advantage over opposition," he wrote.

312.title: New IT park, 4 IT corridors, 20 satellite IT hubs proposed in Kerala Budget
312.article_body: Kerala Finance Minister KN Balagopal, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 in Assembly on Friday, proposed to set up a new IT park, four IT corridors and 20 satellite IT hubs. Balagopal added that ₹100 crore has been set aside for the expansion of the IT parks and ₹1,000 crore has been earmarked for land acquisition in the sector.

313.title: Police lathi-charge SP-RLD supporters after they pelt stones in UP
313.article_body: Police lathi-charged SP-RLD supporters in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat on Thursday after they tried to forcefully enter a vote counting centre and pelted stones at police officers. Three police officers and six SP-RLD supporters were injured. The SP-RLD supporters had allegedly been angered after the BJP candidate defeated the SP candidate from the Baraut seat with a margin of 315 votes.

314.title: Crypto brain drain is crazy in India: Dubai-based Polygon Co-founder
314.article_body: Dubai-based blockchain platform Polygon Co-founder Sandeep Nailwal while discussing India's cryptocurrency sector and its regulations said, "The brain drain is absolutely crazy." He discussed how developers, investors and entrepreneurs are leaving for places with more friendly regulation. He said he wishes to stay in India and promote the Web3 ecosystem but regulatory uncertainty is a hurdle.

315.title: Kerala HC allows 10-year-old rape survivor to terminate pregnancy
315.article_body: The Kerala High Court allowed medical termination of the 30-week-old pregnancy of a 10-year-old rape survivor. A medical board constituted to examine the victim, had said that an operative delivery was needed and there is an 80% chance of the baby surviving. "The court should invoke the jurisdiction, in this case, keeping in mind the Almighty," the bench said.

316.title: Biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik starring Salman shelved: Reports
316.article_body: A biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik, who was known as Black Tiger, has reportedly been shelved. Salman Khan had announced the project last year. According to reports, filmmaker Raj Kumar Gupta had the rights for five years which have now expired. The reports also mentioned that the 'Ek Tha Tiger' actor was also apprehensive about playing another spy.

317.title: It needs to be second nature: Karthik on Pant's 'technical flaw'
317.article_body: Dinesh Karthik termed Rishabh Pant's inability to get his hands in the right position previously as a "technical flaw", adding that it needs to be "second nature" because of the lack of time. "He has worked on that. It takes...time to settle in," stated Karthik. "Repetition is very important..., the amount of work he has put in...is reflecting," said Karthik.

318.title: Railway operations disrupted after crude bomb found on tracks in Bihar
318.article_body: Railway operations were disrupted for at least two hours after a crude bomb was found on the railway tracks near Guraru railway station in Bihar's Gaya district, according to police. The bomb was found within 100 metres of the railway station, Gaya ASP Manish Kumar said. The explosive was defused by the bomb squad on the tracks.

319.title: UP elections result a lesson, should learn from it: BSP chief Mayawati
319.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati said that the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections result is a lesson. "We should not be discouraged by it. Instead, we should learn from it, introspect...carry forward our party movement, and come back to power," she added. "Negative campaigns succeeded in misleading...that BSP is BJP's B-team...while the truth is opposite," Mayawati further said.

320.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 3 for possessing, selling drugs
320.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Thursday arrested three people for possessing drugs and seized four hash oil bottles weighing 20 ml. According to Lallaguda SHO Madhulatha, the accused were apprehended in Lalapet where they were trying to sell the drugs to needy customers. Police also seized three mobile phones used in the commission of the offence.

321.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in Punjab Assembly elections?
321.article_body: AAP's Kulwant Singh, richest candidate in Punjab Assembly elections with over ₹238-crore assets, won SAS Nagar seat by beating Congress' Balbir Singh Sidhu by 34,097 votes. SAD leader and ex-Deputy CM Sukhbir Singh Badal, second-richest candidate with ₹202-crore assets, lost from Jalalabad to AAP's Jagdeep Kamboj by 30,930 votes. Congress' Karan Kaur, third-richest candidate, lost from Muktsar.

322.title: Untrained people won't be sent to frontlines: Ukraine Defence Min
322.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said that more than 1,00,000 Ukrainians have joined the country's territorial defence unit. However, he added that untrained civilians taking up arms against Russia won't be sent into frontline battles. "It doesn't make any sense...Being outnumbered, our army is still stopping enemy forces because it's motivated, better trained and armed," Reznikov said.

323.title: All artists are equal: Big B as a fan compares him to other actors
323.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan responded to a fan who praised his performance in the recently released film 'Jhund' and tweeted, "A man in 80 delivers a new level Cinema...much better than 30-60 heroes giving nowadays." The fan added that 'Jhund' is a "clean family film with a concrete message". "Humbled and embarrassed by...comparison. All artists are equal...please don't give comparisons," Amitabh wrote.

324.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in UP Assembly elections?
324.article_body: Congress' Nawab Kazim Ali Khan, the richest candidate with over ₹296-crore assets, lost from Rampur seat after receiving 4,000 votes. AIMIM's Shah Alam, the second-richest candidate with assets over ₹195 crore, lost from Mubarakpur after receiving fourth-highest votes (36,460). SP's Supriya Aron, the third-richest candidate with assets over ₹157 crore, lost from Bareilly Cantt by 10,768 votes.

325.title: Social media users criticise Ola for its '8 missed calls from mom' notification
325.article_body: Social media users have criticised Ola after it sent a notification that read '8 missed calls from mom'. Ola sent the notification to promote 40% discount on certain services. "Why is Ola traumatising me like this?" a user asked, while another user wrote, "Ola, are you trying to give me a heart attack?"

326.title: 16-year-old girl raped by 4 men over 6 days in B'luru; 6 arrested
326.article_body: Six people, including two women, have been arrested after a 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped by four men over six days in Bengaluru, police said on Friday. The women reportedly sold the girl to people after threatening her. One of the women also apparently laced the girl's drink with sedatives and when she woke up, she found bloodstains on herself.

327.title: Unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on our soil: Pakistan
327.article_body: Pakistan has claimed that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on its soil on Wednesday evening. Pakistan said that the missile was cruising at an altitude of 40,000 feet and endangered passenger flights in both Indian and Pakistani airspace, and also civilians and property on the ground. There were no human casualties.

328.title: Man held for false bomb blast threat at Mumbai University campus
328.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly making a false bomb blast threat at Mumbai University campus, police said on Thursday. "A man called police control room on Wednesday evening and threatened to blow Mumbai University Campus within 10 minutes," an officer told ANI. However, police found nothing upon inspection. The accused was arrested from Santacruz area of Mumbai, police added.

329.title: Mayawati, Owaisi contributed to BJP's win in UP: Sanjay Raut
329.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday said that BSP chief Mayawati and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi contributed to BJP's win in the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. "They must be given Padma Vibhushan and Bharat Ratna," he added. "BJP achieved a great victory. UP was their state, still, Akhilesh Yadav's seats have increased three times," Raut further said.

330.title: Woman constable accuses police inspector of raping her in B'luru, lodges FIR
330.article_body: A female police constable accused a police inspector of rape on the pretext of marriage in Bengaluru. The constable has filed an FIR against the inspector, attached to the State Intelligence Department, in which she has further accused him of threatening her and forcing her to swallow pills for abortion. The Govindarajnagar Police Station is conducting the investigation.

331.title: Extremist acts: Russia on Meta allowing posts seeking Putin's death
331.article_body: The Russian embassy in the US has asked the government to stop the "extremist activities" of Facebook-parent Meta after it temporarily lifted a ban on posts calling for Russian President Vladimir Putin's death. "Meta's...criminal policy leading to incitement of...hostility towards Russians is outrageous," the embassy said. Meta said it won't allow "credible" calls for violence against civilians.

332.title: Russia bans export of 200 products till end of 2022 amid sanctions
332.article_body: Russia has banned the export of over 200 products till the end of this year after the US, EU and others hit the country with sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine. The ban covers telecoms, medical, auto, agricultural and electrical equipment and some forestry products like timber. The measure is necessary "to maintain stability on the Russian market", it said.

333.title: National Lok Adalat to be held in all courts in Pune tomorrow
333.article_body: National Lok Adalat will be organised at all the courts in Pune tomorrow. During this, courts will take up 45,000 pending cases from the district and 1.75 lakh pre-litigation cases that had been kept for compromise. An arrangement has also been made for paying the compromise and penalties in the cases through e-challans in the National Lok Adalat.

334.title: No chemical weapons were developed on my land: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
334.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy refuted Russia's claims that Ukraine is developing biological weapons and is planning "chemical attack". "No chemical or any other weapons of mass destruction were developed on my land," he said. The accusations "makes me...worried because we've been repeatedly convinced, if you want to know Russia's plans, look at what it accuses others of [doing]", he added.

335.title: 5 men rob ₹1.1 cr at gunpoint, donate ₹1 lakh at temple in Delhi; held
335.article_body: Delhi Police arrested five men a week after they allegedly robbed two employees of a businessman of ₹1.1 crore in Delhi's Civil Lines area. The accused had also donated ₹1 lakh of the robbed amount at a temple, police said. "The accused pulled out their pistols, threatened the victims and took the bags with money," police added.

336.title: Can sit together without masks due to PM Modi's efforts: JP Nadda
336.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda lauded PM Narendra Modi's effort in tackling the COVID-19 situation in India and said that it's because of him that now we can sit close to each other without wearing masks. "Over 180 crore people have been prepared (to fight COVID) by giving COVID vaccination...at a time when western countries find themselves in trouble," he added.

337.title: Calcutta HC stays Bengal's order suspending internet during Madhyamik exams
337.article_body: The Calcutta High Court imposed an interim stay on West Bengal government's order suspending internet connectivity in parts of the state on the days of Madhyamik (Class 10 state board) examinations. The order was challenged by the Internet Freedom Foundation (IFF) on the ground that such an order couldn't have been issued by the state under Section 144 of CrPC.

338.title: It was his concern for us that claimed his life: Friend of Indian killed in Ukraine
338.article_body: Talking about 21-year-old Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar who was killed in shelling in Ukraine, his friend Amit Vaishyar said, "We were out of food and water...He went early in the morning to bring food." Vaishyar added, "It was his concern towards us that claimed his life. Usually, two people go to fetch food, but that day, he was alone."

339.title: 33-yr-old Indian-American among 2 indicted in US for crypto money laundering
339.article_body: A US court has indicted two people, including an Indian-American, for their roles in a cryptocurrency money laundering scheme. If convicted, 75-year-old Lois Boyd and 33-year-old Manik Mehtani, both from Virginia, could face up to 20 years in federal prison. In the course of their operation, Boyd, Mehtani and their co-conspirators allegedly laundered over $750,000, federal prosecutors alleged.

340.title: Nitin Gadkari thanks people who voted for BJP in Assembly polls
340.article_body: As BJP retained all four states it ruled in the Assembly elections, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari thanked the voters for voting in favour of the saffron party. He further said, "The success that BJP has achieved is because of the work in these states under the leadership of PM Modi. People have given their support...through this victory."

341.title: What were the final results of the Assembly elections in 5 states?
341.article_body: Election Commission has declared final results of Assembly elections held in Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur. BJP won the elections in UP with 255 seats, while Aam Aadmi Party won in Punjab with 92 seats. In Uttarakhand, BJP won with 47 seats. BJP became the single largest party in Goa, however it could not attain the majority mark.

342.title: Supreme Court issues notice on MediaOne TV's plea challenging ban
342.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday issued notice on a plea challenging Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV's ban. "The respondents shall produce all the relevant files on which reliance is placed by Kerala HC in the impugned judgement on the next date of listing," SC said. Centre had banned the telecast of MediaOne TV, which is backed by Jamaat-e-Islami, citing security reasons.

343.title: India is good at managing finances but global energy price rise will impact it: IMF
343.article_body: IMF's Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva has said that "India has been very good in managing its finances" but the surge in global energy prices will have a negative impact on the Indian economy. The price rise amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine has "implications on the purchasing power of Indian households", IMF's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath said during a roundtable.

344.title: BJP won polls because of good governance: Sarbananda Sonowal
344.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal credited BJP's "good governance" after the party retained all four states it ruled in the Assembly elections. "The Central government under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi focussed on giving good governance so that livelihood of the people can be improved and social security can be provided to the people," Sonowal said.

345.title: TSRTC begins baby stroller services at Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station in Hyd
345.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started a baby stroller service at Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station in Hyderabad for the convenience of women passengers carrying luggage and travelling with children at the same time. TSRTC Regional Manager said the bus station is very huge and it gets difficult for elderly and women to carry children along with luggage.
