346.title: US includes $14 billion for war-hit Ukraine in $1.5 trillion spending bill
346.article_body: The US Congress has passed $1.5 trillion spending bill, including almost $14 billion in humanitarian and military aid to war-hit Ukraine. "We're keeping our promise to support Ukraine as they fight for their lives against the evil Vladimir Putin," Chuck Schumer, the leader of the Senate Democrats, said in a statement

347.title: I was bullied in school, once wore mom's makeup to look lighter: Masaba
347.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta, daughter of Neena Gupta and former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, recalled having issues with her appearance and being bullied in her school for the same. She revealed that she once used her mother's foundation to lighten the colour of her skin. "I didn't realise...it's not...colour of my skin...I went to school...everyone...figured it out," Masaba said.

348.title: We've shown BJP's seats can be reduced: SP chief on UP poll results
348.article_body: Following Uttar Pradesh Assembly election results, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Friday tweeted that his party has "shown that BJP's seat count can be reduced and that the fall will continue". He also thanked the people for increasing "SP seats by 2.5 times and vote share by 1.5 times". BJP won 255 assembly seats in UP, while SP secured 111.

349.title: Paragliding banned until further orders in Himachal's Kangra after 2 deaths
349.article_body: All paragliding activities have been banned in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra by the District Administration until further orders. The ban has been put under Disaster Management Act. The decision came after two people died and one was seriously injured after they fell off a paraglider while taking off in Bir Billing of Kangra district on Tuesday.

350.title: Djokovic one of the few players who can cause problems for Nadal: Evert
350.article_body: Discussing Novak Djokovic who is expected to play in French Open 2022, 18-time Grand Slam champion Chris Evert said Djokovic is one of the few players who can cause problems for Rafael Nadal on clay. Daniil Medvedev recently replaced Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player. France has dropped its vaccine pass rule resulting in an opportunity for Djokovic.

351.title: Number of vehicles on Mumbai's road crosses 42-lakh mark: Survey
351.article_body: The number of vehicles on roads of Mumbai has crossed the 42-lakh mark, Maharashtra government's Economic Survey 2022 revealed.  This is 10.3% of the total number of vehicles in Maharashtra standing at 4.09 crore. According to the report, the number of electric vehicles has increased in Maharashtra with over 46,000 e-vehicles registered across the state as of December 2021.

352.title: ISIS confirms death of its leader Abu Ibrahim, names new chief
352.article_body: The Islamic State has confirmed the death of its leader Abu Ibrahim Al-hashemi Al-Quraishi and its spokesperson Abu Hamza Al-Quraishi. The Islamic State further named Abu Al-Hassan Al-hashemi Al-Quraishi as its new chief. This comes after the US administration said that Abu Ibrahim died in a US special forces raid in northern Syria in February.

353.title: Twitter to label Belarus state media's posts, limit their spread
353.article_body: Twitter will be labelling and limiting the spread of posts from Belarus state media and their senior staff, aiming to curb misinformation. It will label about 15 Belarusian outlets, including news agency BelTa, which has nearly 37,000 followers on the service. Twitter's head of site integrity Yoel Roth said the outlets and their Russian affiliates have "engaged in information warfare".

354.title: MediBuddy unveils #HealthUnlimited campaign featuring Amitabh Bachchan
354.article_body: Digital healthcare platform MediBuddy has unveiled its campaign #HealthUnlimited featuring Amitabh Bachchan. Its brand film aims to convey that common health issues can arise at any time, affecting anyone. It advocates prioritizing your health along with your loved ones with MediBuddy Gold, promising unlimited expert doctor consultations across 18 departments, 24/7 for health-related situations.

355.title: Aditya Narayan shares glimpse of his newborn daughter Tvisha
355.article_body: Singer and host Aditya Narayan took to Instagram to share the first glimpse of his newborn daughter Tvisha. "Grateful, lucky, blessed! Going to spend the next few weeks with my angels. See you soon, digital world," he wrote. Earlier, Aditya had revealed that Tvisha was born on February 24. "Shweta and I feel extremely blessed," he had said.

356.title: Which party got how many votes in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections?
356.article_body: BJP, which emerged as the single-largest party with 255 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, also had the highest vote share of 41.3% (38,051,721 votes). SP, which won 111 seats, had a vote share of 32.1% (29,543,934 votes). BSP had a vote share of 12.9%, while Congress had a vote share of 2.3%.

357.title: 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' crosses ₹100-crore mark, Alia Bhatt celebrates with vegan burger
357.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Stories to share that her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed ₹100-crore mark at the domestic box office. She also shared pictures of herself having vegan burger to celebrate the milestone. "Happy century to Gangubai & happy vegan burger + fry to Alia...Thank you for all the love," she wrote.

358.title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg offers to cover insurance for fired expecting parents
358.article_body: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg said he'll pay insurance expenses for a group of expectant parents, who lost their jobs as the company fired around 3,000 US and India employees this week. The mortgage lending startup is offering extended medical benefits to 19 expecting parents, an internal communication said. Earlier, Garg was criticised for firing 900 employees on a Zoom call.

359.title: Hrithik, Deepika's 'Fighter' release postponed, film to release in Sep 2023
359.article_body: The makers of Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Fighter' have announced a new release date of the film. The action thriller, which was earlier supposed to release on January 26, 2023, will now hit the screens on September 28, 2023. In addition to Hrithik and Deepika, it'll also feature Anil Kapoor. 'Fighter' marks the first collaboration between Hrithik and Deepika.

360.title: Theft suspect kills self in Mumbai, family alleges police harassment
360.article_body: A 23-year-old man, suspected of stealing a bike, allegedly died by suicide at his residence in Mumbai's Dahisar on Wednesday. Victim Raj Pawar's family alleged he took the step after being harassed by the police a day before. "An enquiry has been set up under assistant commissioner of police to probe the grievance," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

361.title: How does the Women's World Cup points table read after India's defeat?
361.article_body: Following India's defeat against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, hosts New Zealand jumped to second spot with four points from three matches and a net run-rate of +0.799. India are fifth with a win and a defeat in their first two matches. Australia are on top of the standings with four points and a net run-rate of +1.061.

362.title: Destroy disease-causing pathogens from labs: WHO to Ukraine
362.article_body:
The World Health Organization (WHO) said it has advised Ukraine to destroy "high-threat pathogens to prevent any potential spills" that would spread disease among the population. Biosecurity experts
said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine has raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens. The WHO didn't provide specifics about the pathogens or toxins housed in Ukraine's laboratories.

363.title: Man in US alerts police after watching burglar entering his Hyd home on CCTV
363.article_body: A Hyderabad resident living in the US prevented a burglary attempt at his home after he noticed an intruder and alerted the police. The house owner watched the CCTV footage of a burglar breaking into his house in KPHB colony, police said. He then alerted the neighbours who noticed the lock had been broken and the house bolted from inside.

364.title: 11-year-old accident victim gives new life to 4 in Chandigarh
364.article_body: An 11-year-old girl, Nayna Thakur, who was declared brain dead by doctors at PGIMER in Chandigarh after a fatal accident, has given new lives to four people. Her family donated her organs after which her kidneys were transplanted to matching receipts. Her corneas also helped two blind people restore their eyesight. Doctors have praised Nayna's family for their brave decision.

365.title: ACP booked, 3 aides arrested for assaulting family in Punjab's Ludhiana
365.article_body: An assistant commissioner of police (ACP) has been booked and three of his aides have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a family in a bid to grab their land in Punjab's Ludhiana. ACP, who was present at the spot at the time of the assault, fled. "ACP wanted to grab 600 square-yard plot for a long time," the complainant said.

366.title: Case against private resort owners in K'taka for encroaching forest land
366.article_body: A forest offence case (FOC) has been registered against the owners of a private resort for alleged encroachment of over five-acre land of Moorkannugudda forest in Karnataka's Sakleshpur. "The proprietors concerned say that they have bought the land from the revenue department. However, no revenue officer has any authority to grant forest land," a senior forest department official said.

367.title: At least 40 COVID patients overcharged at Gurugram hospitals last year
367.article_body: At least 40 COVID-19 patients were overcharged at Gurugram hospitals during the second wave of pandemic last year with bills going up to ₹31 lakh, the district administration said. These hospitals have been asked to refund the extra amount to the patients. The administration had received 65 complaints of overcharging at private hospitals including 10 major hospitals, an official confirmed.

368.title: Russia says pic of injured pregnant woman in Ukraine attack is 'fake', calls her 'actor'
368.article_body: The Russian Embassy in UK has tweeted that a viral picture of a pregnant woman injured during the Ukraine maternity hospital attack is "fake". The embassy said that the attack on the hospital in Mariupol was staged, alleging that the pregnant victim was an "actor". Twitter deleted the tweets from the embassy, saying they were in violation of rules.

369.title: West Bengal relaxes night curfew on Holi eve for Holika Dahan celebrations
369.article_body: The West Bengal government on Thursday announced that it would lift night curfew in the state on the night of 17 March, the day before Holi, to enable the celebration of 'Holika Dahan'. Restrictions relating to the movement of people and vehicles between 12 am and 5 am shall be relaxed, the state government said in an order.

370.title: India reports 4,194 COVID-19 cases, 255 deaths in last 24 hours
370.article_body: India has reported 4,194 new COVID-19 cases and 255 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,184 cases and 104 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 42,219, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,714.

371.title: First drone school inaugurated in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior
371.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated the first "drone school" in Gwalior on Thursday. Chouhan said that this is the first of the five drone schools that have been planned in the state. He added that the use of drones will increase in the coming times and will create employment opportunities.

372.title: TikTok nears data-storage deal with Oracle for US users: Reports
372.article_body: TikTok is close to completing a deal with Oracle to store its US users' data, media reports said. Oracle had earlier discussed acquiring a minority stake in TikTok in 2020, when ByteDance faced pressure from the US government to sell the app. TikTok is also exploring partnerships with other technology companies over firewalls and cyber security measures.

373.title: Former FCI DGM, wife convicted of money laundering, get 3 years in jail
373.article_body: A Chennai court has convicted a former deputy general manager (DGM) of the Food Corporation of India (FCI), Dorai Raj and his wife, Sarumathi of money laundering, Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. The two convicts have been sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment. The court has also ordered for "immediate confiscation" of Sarumathi's attached property worth ₹81 lakh, ED added.

374.title: Thane petrol pump employee refuses to give man diesel in water bottle, attacked
374.article_body: A man attacked an employee of a petrol pump with a paver block on his head in Thane's Ulhasnagar after the latter refused to give diesel to him in a plastic bottle. Police are trying to trace the accused using CCTV footage. "The bottle's mouth was small. The nozzle of the petrol pump couldn't fit inside it," an officer said.

375.title: Centre giving 'stepmotherly' treatment to Maha: Awhad on Dharavi project
375.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of Housing Jitendra Awhad alleged that Centre is not paying attention to the Dharavi redevelopment plan even after the state government paid ₹800 crore for 45 acres of land. Why the Centre is giving a "stepmotherly" treatment to the state, Awhad said in the Assembly. Maharashtra government has written at least 10 letters to Centre, he further added.

376.title: 7 booked for trying to kill a 15-yr-old boy during fight in Pune
376.article_body: Pune police have booked seven persons for allegedly attempting to murder a 15-year-old boy during a fight between two groups in the Janata Vasahat slum area. The accused had reportedly attacked the victim and his friends with sickles and bamboo sticks, causing multiple injuries. The accused claimed that it was revenge for a sickle attack on the accused's friends.

377.title: Facebook allows posts seeking violence against 'Russian invaders' or Putin's death
377.article_body: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has temporarily eased rules to allow users in some countries to use violent speech like 'death to Russian invaders' in context of Ukraine's invasion, Reuters reported citing internal emails. "We still won't allow credible calls for violence against Russian civilians," a statement said. It's also allowing some posts that call for death to President Vladimir Putin.

378.title: PSG President threatens to kill Real Madrid staff member after CL defeat: Reports
378.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League round of 16, PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi went to referee's room and allegedly broke officiating equipment in anger. He also threatened to kill Real Madrid employee, who was recording the incident. Al-Khelaifi was reportedly unhappy about Karim Benzema's challenge on goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in second-half of second leg.

379.title: S Africa asked to mediate in Russia-Ukraine conflict: Prez Ramaphosa
379.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that "based on its relations with Russia and as a member of BRICS", South Africa has been asked to mediate in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Ramaphosa did not reveal who made the request. However, he added he has told Russian President Vladimir Putin in a phone call that the conflict should be settled through negotiations.

380.title: Auto-rickshaw driver, his 3 aides rob Pune passenger at knifepoint, booked
380.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides have been booked for allegedly robbing a 35-year-old passenger of his mobile phone and ₹500 at knifepoint in Pune. Police said the victim had boarded the auto-rickshaw near Khuda bridge during early morning. Three more people were present in the vehicle and the driver said that he would drop him in the Deccan area.

381.title: Top Russian commander who was awarded Order of Courage by Putin killed in Ukraine
381.article_body: A top Russian commander was killed by Ukrainian forces in an ambush on tanks that they forced into retreat outside Kyiv. Colonel Andrei Zakharov was awarded the Order of Courage by Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2016. At least five other Russian commanders have been killed since the invasion was launched two weeks ago, Ukraine has claimed.

382.title: 9 B'luru malls haven't paid ₹69 cr property tax to BBMP: K'taka CM
382.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that nine malls in Bengaluru haven't paid property tax worth a total of about ₹69 crore to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Bommai said this while replying during the Question Hour in the state Legislative Council. According to the data provided by Bommai, Mantri Mall hasn't paid ₹20.33 crore property tax.

383.title: Man uses car with Delhi Police sticker for liquor smuggling, arrested
383.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested for smuggling liquor using a car with a Delhi Police sticker on its windscreen. Police laid a trap to arrest the man, a resident of Najafgarh, after receiving a tip-off. Police intercepted the car in the Shalimar Bagh area and found it was loaded with 24 boxes of illicit liquor, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani said.

384.title: 3 town planning schemes passed for Pune's Uruli Devachi, Phursungi
384.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved three town planning schemes' execution around the proposed Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority ring road. The schemes will come up at Uruli Devachi and Phursungi on 650 hectares of land. PMC Leader of House Ganesh Bidkar said it's a win-win situation as PMC will get land for free and landowners will receive developed land.

385.title: World's longest car with swimming pool, helipad breaks its own Guinness record
385.article_body: The world's longest car, a super-limousine, has broken its own Guinness World Record for previously being the longest car. First built in California in 1986 by car customiser Jay Ohrberg, 'The American Dream' originally measured 60 feet. Ohrberg later extended the limo to 100 feet. It includes a large waterbed, a swimming pool, jacuzzi, bathtub, mini-golf course and a helipad.

386.title: Delhi HC directs DMRC to pay ₹6,330 cr to Reliance's Airport Express Line
386.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to pay ₹6,330 crore to Reliance Infrastructure's Delhi Airport Metro Express Private Limited (DAMEPL) for an arbitration award passed in 2017. It asked DMRC to divert funds or raise loans to pay the amount to DAMEPL. DMRC is required to pay the amount in three installments by May 31.

387.title: Final results of UP Assembly election out; BJP wins 255 of 403 seats
387.article_body: The Election Commission has declared the final results of Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, with BJP winning 255 of 403 assembly seats in the state. While BJP will return to power in the state, Samajwadi Party secured 111 seats. Congress won two seats, BSP won one and Apna Dal (Soneylal) won 12 seats.

388.title: BJP wins 47 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand as EC declares final results
388.article_body: BJP will form the government for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after securing 47 of 70 seats in the state assembly election. According to the results declared by Election Commission, Congress won 19 assembly seats and BSP won two seats. Meanwhile, Independent candidates secured win over two seats in the state.

389.title: Japan to give ₹65,000 to foreign students in financial trouble: Report
389.article_body: Japan will give 100,000 yen (over ₹65,000) to support foreign exchange students who are facing financial trouble due to COVID-19, local media reported. The cash handout is reportedly aimed to aide people studying in Japanese universities, colleges and vocational schools. The move comes after Japan eased its entry requirements for visitors, including international students, earlier this month.

390.title: Incredibly lucky to be alive after beating cancer: Stanley Tucci
390.article_body: Actor Stanley Tucci has said he feels "incredibly lucky" after successfully fighting a battle with cancer. "They [doctors] couldn't do surgery because the tumour was so big. It's a miracle that it didn't metastasize," he said. The actor underwent a 35-day radiation treatment and seven sessions of chemotherapy, which affected his senses of taste and smell.

391.title: 700g marijuana, GOGO cigarettes recovered from drug peddler in MP
391.article_body: A 24-year-old drug peddler was arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Rajpur following a tip-off and 700 grams of marijuana and marijuana-filled GOGO cigarettes were recovered from him, police said. During interrogation, the peddler revealed he sold the 20 grams drug packets for ₹200 and GOGO cigarettes for ₹100. A case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act has been registered.

392.title: Canada's Ontario to lift mandatory mask rule on March 21
392.article_body: Canada's Ontario is set to lift its mandatory mask rule for most settings, including schools, from March 21 onwards, officials announced on Wednesday. "We're now learning to live with...COVID-19 for the long term...This necessitates a shift to a more balanced response," Ontario Chief Medical Officer of Health Dr Kieran Moore said. Ontario reported 2,125 COVID-19 cases on Thursday.

393.title: PMC beautifies 7,000 sq feet underutilised plot at Prem Nagar slums
393.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has transformed a 7,000 square feet street space into a public space at Prem Nagar slums. A member of the initiative said that the space had been underutilised before and mostly used for parking. "The initiative saw the light of the day with the support of MLA Sunil Kamble and PMC officials," he added.

394.title: Our needs are linked to both nations: PM on India's neutrality on Russia-Ukraine
394.article_body: Talking about the Russia-Ukraine war and India's neutral stance on the conflict, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "India's several needs are connected to these countries." He said that India has economic, security-related, education-related and political links with both Russia and Ukraine. India had earlier abstained from voting on a UNGA resolution against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

395.title: No fast track exists for Ukraine's EU membership: Dutch PM
395.article_body: Speaking about Ukraine's application to join the European Union, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Thursday that there is no fast track procedure to become a member of the EU. Ukraine had applied for EU membership shortly after the Russian invasion. Rutte made the comment as he arrived at an EU summit at the Versailles Palace in France.

396.title: 100% crowd to be allowed for India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test in Bengaluru
396.article_body: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru will be allowed to have a 100% capacity crowd for the second India-Sri Lanka Test, confirmed Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA). Earlier, only 50% of the crowd was allowed due to COVID related restrictions. The second Test, beginning Saturday, will be a Day-Night Test. India lead the two-match series 1-0.

397.title: Man jailed for 8 yrs, fined ₹25,000 for sexually assaulting 13-yr-old
397.article_body: A man has been sentenced to eight years in jail for committing a sexual assault on a 13-year-old intellectually disabled girl in Mumbai in 2016. The accused who was aged 25 at the time had taken advantage of her, the special judge observed while refusing to show leniency in the matter. A ₹25,000 fine has also been imposed on him.

398.title: India is on the side of peace: PM Modi on Russia-Ukraine crisis
398.article_body: While giving a speech to party workers at BJP headquarters, PM Narendra Modi spoke about ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. "The ongoing war is affecting every country across the world. India is on side of peace and hopes that all problems are resolved with deliberations," he stated. PM Modi further said India's several needs are connected to the countries involved in war.

399.title: Nadal's start to 2022 season reminds me of Federer in 2017: Haas
399.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas has said Rafael Nadal's 15-0 start to the 2022 season reminds him of Roger Federer's 2017 start (19-1), when the 20-time Grand Slam made a comeback from a knee surgery after six months. Nadal, who came back from a foot injury, has won Melbourne Summer Set, Australian Open and Mexican Open titles so far.

400.title: Let the American broomstick fly: SpaceX director on launch of Starlink satellites
400.article_body: SpaceX's launch director took a dig at Russian space agency's chief Dmitry Rogozin's recent remark during launch of Starlink satellites. "Time to let the American broomstick fly and hear the sounds of freedom," the director said as the rocket prepared to take off. Rogozin earlier said Americans could "fly on their broomsticks" after Russia stopped selling rocket engines to US.
